conclusion: The equilateral triangle is composed of uniform resistance wires. Points A and B are connected to a power supply with a constant voltage. The magnetic field is perpendicular to the plane of the triangle.

premise: The triangle is equilateral and the wires are uniform.
conclusion: The current will be distributed equally among the three sides. Let the total current be I. The current through each side of the triangle will be I/3.
The Ampere force on the AB section is given as F.

premise: The force F is due to the current I/3 flowing through the AB section in the magnetic field.
conclusion: The same current I/3 flows through the AC and BC sections.

premise: The magnetic field is perpendicular to the plane of the triangle.
conclusion: The forces on AC and BC will also be perpendicular to these sides.

premise: The forces on AC and BC will be equal in magnitude to the force on AB, but they will be directed at 120° angles to each other.
conclusion: The resultant force can be found by vector addition of these three forces.

premise: The forces on AC and BC form an angle of 120° with each other and with the force on AB.
conclusion: The resultant force F_resultant can be calculated using the formula for the resultant of three equal forces at 120° angles: F_resultant = √3 × F.

premise: The directions of the two forces are the same.
